questions.body: Which tick genus is the vector for Lyme disease?
Can lactate levels predict mortality in paediatric sepsis?
questions.output_answer:
yes
Based on the data provided, lactate levels can predict mortality in paediatric sepsis. Several studies indicate that higher lactate levels are associated with worse outcomes. For instance, one study found that 24-hour lactate levels were higher among non-survivors compared to survivors and that lactate levels positively correlated with severity of illness scores like pSOFA, PRISM, and PIM2. Another study noted that children able to clear lactate within 8 hours had an improved chance of survival, while those with lactate levels that did not decrease significantly had a higher risk of death. Additionally, elevated lactate levels at admission were associated with higher mortality rates in neonatal sepsis.
